creator: da@procom.de
text:
The tomcat DirContextURLStreamHandlerFactory class produces a
URLStreamHandler for handling 'jndi' URL's.
On tomcat standalone this works fine.

The Jave 2 Api says that a URLStreamHandler must be named
<package>.<protocol>.Handler.java. This class exists in the tomcat 4.0
sources (@author Remy Maucherat;-)) , but is not included in the
naming-resources.jar. I need this class, because i am running tomcat included in
jboss. JBoss has it's own URLStreamHandlerFactory, which is conform to the Java
2 API.
Is there a reason why the tomcat Factory creates a DirContextURLStreamHandler
and not a jndi.Handler ?
It is possible to add the Handler class to the jar?
*** Bug 26879 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
This has been fixed in CVs for TC4.1.x

TC5.5.x already includes this class.

You will still need to add the package to the "java.protocol.handler.pkgs"
system property as per http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/net/URL.html
to make this handler visible to java.net.URL
creator: markt@apache.org
